name: github
label: GitHub
description: GitHub is a code hosting platform for collaboration and version control. This connector facilitates automated interactions with Github, such as to create and manage repositories, branches, issues, pull requests, and many more.

fields.title: Server URL
fields.name: server_url
fields.description: The URL of the GitHub to which you will connect and perform the automated operations.

fields.title: Username
fields.name: username
fields.description: The username used to access the GitHub to which you will connect and perform the automated operations.

fields.title: Personal Access Token
fields.name: password
fields.description: The Personal Access Token used to access the GitHub server to which you will connect and perform the automated operations.

operations.title: Create Organization Repository
operations.description: Creates a new repository in the specified organization. The authenticated user must be a member of the organization.

parameters.title: Organization Name
parameters.name: org
parameters.tooltip: The organization name. The name is not case sensitive.
parameters.description: The organization name. The name is not case sensitive.

parameters.title: Repository Name
parameters.name: name
parameters.tooltip: The name of the repository.
parameters.description: The name of the repository.

parameters.title: Description
parameters.name: description
parameters.tooltip: A short description of the repository.
parameters.description: A short description of the repository.

parameters.title: Homepage
parameters.name: homepage
parameters.tooltip: A URL with more information about the repository.
parameters.description: A URL with more information about the repository.

parameters.title: Private
parameters.name: private
parameters.tooltip: Whether the repository is private.
parameters.description: Whether the repository is private.

parameters.title: Has Issues
parameters.name: has_issues
parameters.tooltip: Either true to enable issues for this repository or false to disable them. Default: true
parameters.description: Either true to enable issues for this repository or false to disable them.

parameters.title: Has Projects
parameters.name: has_projects
parameters.tooltip: Either true to enable projects for this repository or false to disable them. Note: If you're creating a repository in an organization that has disabled repository projects, the default is false, and if you pass true, the API returns an error
parameters.description: Either true to enable projects for this repository or false to disable them. Note: If you're creating a repository in an organization that has disabled repository projects, the default is false, and if you pass true, the API returns an error

parameters.title: Has Wiki
parameters.name: has_wiki
parameters.tooltip: Either true to enable the wiki for this repository or false to disable it. Default: true
parameters.description: Either true to enable the wiki for this repository or false to disable it. Default: true

parameters.title: Is Template
parameters.name: is_template
parameters.tooltip: Either true to make this repo available as a template repository or false to prevent it.
parameters.description: Either true to make this repo available as a template repository or false to prevent it.

parameters.title: Other Fields
parameters.description: (Optional) Like Search criteria (used to determine dynamic membership) field or links field json request are to be define.
parameters.name: other_fields

operations.title: List Organization Repositories
operations.description: Lists repositories for the specified organization.

parameters.title: Organization Name
parameters.name: org
parameters.tooltip: The organization name. The name is not case sensitive.
parameters.description: The organization name. The name is not case sensitive.

parameters.title: Repository Type
parameters.name: type
parameters.tooltip: Specifies the types of repositories you want returned.
parameters.description: Specifies the types of repositories you want returned.

parameters.title: Sort Repository By
parameters.name: sort
parameters.tooltip: The property to sort the results by.
parameters.description: The property to sort the results by.

parameters.title: Direction Repository By
parameters.name: direction
parameters.tooltip: The property to sort the results by.
parameters.description: The property to sort the results by.

parameters.title: Per Page
parameters.name: per_page
parameters.tooltip: The number of results per page (max 100). Default: 30
parameters.description: The number of results per page (max 100). Default: 30

parameters.title: Page
parameters.name: page
parameters.tooltip: Page number of the results to fetch. Default: 1
parameters.description: Page number of the results to fetch. Default: 1

parameters.description: The name of the repository. The name is not case sensitive.

parameters.description: specify the organization name if forking into an organization.

operations.title: List User Repositories
operations.description: Lists public repositories for the specified user. Note: For GitHub AE, this endpoint will list internal repositories for the specified user.

parameters.name: username
parameters.tooltip: The handle for the GitHub user account.
parameters.description: The handle for the GitHub user account.

parameters.title: Repository Type
parameters.name: type
parameters.tooltip: Limit results to repositories of the specified type.
parameters.description: Limit results to repositories of the specified type.

parameters.title: Sort Repository By
parameters.name: sort
parameters.tooltip: The property to sort the results by.
parameters.description: The property to sort the results by.

parameters.title: Direction Repository By
parameters.name: direction
parameters.tooltip: The order to sort by. Default: asc when using full_name, otherwise desc.
parameters.description: The order to sort by. Default: asc when using full_name, otherwise desc.

parameters.title: Per Page

parameters.tooltip: The number of results per page (max 100). Default: 30
parameters.description: The number of results per page (max 100). Default: 30

parameters.description: Page number of the results to fetch. Default: 1

operations.title: Get Branch Revision
operations.description: Retrieve the specified branch revision details.

parameters.title: Repository Owner
parameters.name: owner
parameters.tooltip: The account owner of the repository.
parameters.description: The account owner of the repository. The name is not case sensitive.

parameters.title: Repository Name
parameters.name: repo
parameters.tooltip: The name of the repository
parameters.description: The name of the repository. The name is not case sensitive.

parameters.title: Base Branch
parameters.name: base
parameters.tooltip: The name of the branch who's branch revision you want. This should be an existing branch on the current repository.
parameters.description: The name of the branch who's branch revision you want. This should be an existing branch on the current repository. You cannot submit a pull request to one repository that requests a merge to a base of another repository.

operations.title: Merge Branch
operations.description: Merge Branch

parameters.title: Repository Owner
parameters.name: owner
parameters.tooltip: The account owner of the repository.
parameters.description: The account owner of the repository. The name is not case sensitive.

parameters.title: Repository Name
parameters.name: repo
parameters.tooltip: The name of the repository
parameters.description: The name of the repository. The name is not case sensitive.

parameters.title: Base Branch Name
parameters.name: base
parameters.tooltip: The name of the base branch that the head will be merged into.
parameters.description: The name of the base branch that the head will be merged into.

parameters.title: Head
parameters.name: head
parameters.tooltip: The head to merge. This can be a branch name or a commit SHA1.
parameters.description: The head to merge. This can be a branch name or a commit SHA1.

parameters.title: Commit Message
parameters.name: commit_message
parameters.tooltip: Commit message to use for the merge commit. If omitted, a default message will be used.
parameters.description: Commit message to use for the merge commit. If omitted, a default message will be used.

parameters.title: Protected
parameters.name: protected
parameters.tooltip: Setting to true returns only protected branches. When set to false, only unprotected branches are returned. Omitting this parameter returns all branches.
parameters.description: Setting to true returns only protected branches. When set to false, only unprotected branches are returned. Omitting this parameter returns all branches.

operations.title: Create Pull Request
operations.description: Create the pull request for the specified repository.

parameters.title: Repository Owner
parameters.name: owner
parameters.tooltip: The account owner of the repository.
parameters.description: The account owner of the repository. The name is not case sensitive.

parameters.title: Repository Name
parameters.name: repo
parameters.tooltip: The name of the repository
parameters.description: The name of the repository. The name is not case sensitive.

parameters.title: Head Repository
parameters.name: head
parameters.tooltip: The name of the branch where your changes are implemented. e.g: username:branch.
parameters.description: The name of the branch where your changes are implemented. For cross-repository pull requests in the same network, namespace head with a user like this: username:branch.

parameters.title: Base Branch
parameters.name: base
parameters.tooltip: The name of the branch you want the changes pulled into. This should be an existing branch on the current repository.
parameters.description: The name of the branch you want the changes pulled into. This should be an existing branch on the current repository. You cannot submit a pull request to one repository that requests a merge to a base of another repository.

parameters.title: Pull Request Title
parameters.name: title
parameters.tooltip: The title of the new pull request.
parameters.description: The title of the new pull request.

parameters.title: Pull Request Comments
parameters.name: body
parameters.tooltip: The contents of the pull request.
parameters.description: The contents of the pull request.

parameters.title: Allow Edits By Maintainers
parameters.name: maintainer_can_modify
parameters.tooltip: Indicates whether maintainers can modify the pull request.
parameters.description: Indicates whether maintainers can modify the pull request.

parameters.title: Draft
parameters.name: draft
parameters.tooltip: Indicates whether the pull request is a draft.
parameters.description: Indicates whether the pull request is a draft.

operations.title: List Review Comments on a Pull Request
operations.description: List the Review comments.

parameters.title: Repository Owner
parameters.name: owner
parameters.tooltip: The account owner of the repository.
parameters.description: The account owner of the repository. The name is not case sensitive.

parameters.title: Repository Name
parameters.name: repo
parameters.tooltip: The name of the repository
parameters.description: The name of the repository. The name is not case sensitive.

parameters.title: Pull Number
parameters.name: pull_number
parameters.tooltip: The number that identifies the pull request.
parameters.description: The number that identifies the pull request.

parameters.title: Sort
parameters.name: sort
parameters.description: The property to sort the results by, created means when the repository was starred. updated means when the repository was last pushed to. Default: created
parameters.tooltip: The property to sort the results by.

parameters.title: Direction
parameters.name: direction
parameters.tooltip: The order to sort by. Ignored without sort parameter.
parameters.description: The order to sort by. Ignored without sort parameter.

operations.title: Add Reviewers for a Pull Request
operations.description: Pull request authors and repository owners and collaborators can request a pull request review from anyone with write access to the repository. Each requested reviewer will receive a notification asking them to review the pull request.

parameters.title: Reviewers

parameters.description: Comma separated user names that will be requested.

parameters.title: team Reviewers

parameters.description: Comma separated team names that will be requested.

parameters.description: The number that identifies the pull request.

parameters.description: Title for the automatic commit message.

parameters.name: commit_message
parameters.tooltip: Extra detail to append to automatic commit message.
parameters.description: Extra detail to append to automatic commit message.

parameters.description: SHA that pull request head must match to allow merge.

operations.title: List Releases
operations.description: This returns a list of releases, which does not include regular Git tags that have not been associated with a release. Information about published releases are available to everyone. Only users with push access will receive listings for draft releases.

parameters.title: Repository Owner
parameters.name: owner
parameters.tooltip: The account owner of the repository.
parameters.description: The account owner of the repository. The name is not case sensitive.

parameters.title: Repository Name
parameters.name: repo
parameters.tooltip: The name of the repository
parameters.description: The name of the repository. The name is not case sensitive.

parameters.title: Per Page
parameters.name: per_page
parameters.tooltip: The number of results per page (max 100). Default: 30
parameters.description: The number of results per page (max 100). Default: 30

parameters.title: Page
parameters.name: page
parameters.tooltip: Page number of the results to fetch. Default: 1
parameters.description: Page number of the results to fetch. Default: 1

operations.title: Create Release
operations.description: Users with push access to the repository can create a release.

parameters.title: Repository Owner
parameters.name: owner
parameters.tooltip: The account owner of the repository.
parameters.description: The account owner of the repository. The name is not case sensitive.

parameters.title: Repository Name
parameters.name: repo
parameters.tooltip: The name of the repository
parameters.description: The name of the repository. The name is not case sensitive.

parameters.title: Tag Name
parameters.name: tag_name
parameters.tooltip: The name of the tag.
parameters.description: The name of the tag.

parameters.title: Target Branch
parameters.name: target_commitish
parameters.tooltip: Specifies the commitish value that determines where the Git tag is created from. Default: the repository's default branch (usually master).
parameters.description: Specifies the commitish value that determines where the Git tag is created from. Default: the repository's default branch (usually master).

parameters.title: Release Title
parameters.name: name
parameters.tooltip: The name of the release.
parameters.description: The name of the release.

parameters.title: Release Description
parameters.name: body
parameters.tooltip: Text describing the contents of the tag.
parameters.description: Text describing the contents of the tag.

parameters.title: Generate Release Notes
parameters.name: generate_release_notes
parameters.tooltip: Whether to automatically generate the "Release Title" and "Release Description" for this release. If "Release Title" is specified, the specified "Release Title" will be used; otherwise, a name will be automatically generated. If "Release Description" is specified, the "Release Description" will be pre-pended to the automatically generated notes.
parameters.description: Whether to automatically generate the "Release Title" and "Release Description" for this release. If "Release Title" is specified, the specified "Release Title" will be used; otherwise, a name will be automatically generated. If "Release Description" is specified, the "Release Description" will be pre-pended to the automatically generated notes.

operations.title: Set Repository Subscription
operations.description: If you would like to watch a repository, set subscribed to true. If you would like to ignore notifications made within a repository, set ignored to true. If you would like to stop watching a repository, delete the repository's subscription completely.

parameters.title: Repository Owner
parameters.name: owner
parameters.tooltip: The account owner of the repository.
parameters.description: The account owner of the repository. The name is not case sensitive.

parameters.title: Repository Name
parameters.name: repo
parameters.tooltip: The name of the repository
parameters.description: The name of the repository. The name is not case sensitive.

parameters.title: Subscribed
parameters.name: subscribed
parameters.tooltip: Determines if notifications should be received from this repository.
parameters.description: Determines if notifications should be received from this repository.

parameters.title: Ignored
parameters.name: ignored
parameters.tooltip: Determines if all notifications should be blocked from this repository.
parameters.description: Determines if all notifications should be blocked from this repository.
